caption.p: Euphorbia cuneata (EC) attenuated lipopolysaccharide (LPS)-induced lung injury. ( A) Lung wet/dry weight (W/D) ratio, ( B) protein content, and ( C) lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) activity in bronchoalveolar lavage fluid (BALF). Mice were administered two different doses of EC (25 and 50 mg/kg) or dexamethasone (5 mg/kg) once daily for 5 days prior to intraperitoneal injection of LPS (10 mg/kg). Samples were collected 24 h after LPS injection. Data are the mean Â± SD. ( n = 8). * p < 0.05, ** p < 0.01, *** p < 0.001 vs. control group; ### p < 0.001 vs. LPS group; && p < 0.01 vs. dexamethasone (DEX) + LPS group (one-way ANOVA).
